image.altText: A wide birds eye shot of four swimmers in the sea.

props.synopsis: A heatwave stretching across Australia is in its second day, with authorities battling multiple blazes across Victoria.

title.children: Extreme heat continues in SA as Victoria battles bushfires

image.altText: A smiling woman with long brown hair, wearing a light brown checked blazer, sitting in an office

props.synopsis: After Randa Abdel-Fattah was dropped from Adelaide Writers' Week by the Adelaide Festival Board, a slew of authors, including Michelle de Kretser, have withdrawn from the event.

title.children: Authors withdraw from festival after Palestinian Australian author dropped

image.altText: Carriages from a derailed freight train.

props.synopsis: The derailment of a freight train on a key section of railway in South Australia is affecting all transcontinental train services as heatwave conditions in the area impact the pace of recovery works.

title.children: A derailed freight train has shut a key railway line. Here's what we know

image.altText: Faith Coleman looking down at a microscope.

props.synopsis: An inquiry into South Australia's harmful algal bloom has been rocked by claims from a prominent ecologist, who has raised allegations of government interference in scientific research into the bloom's causes.

title.children: Algal bloom researcher 'deeply disturbed' by political interference claims, committee told

image.altText: A wind turbine silhouetted against a clear sky.

props.synopsis: The Kentbruck Green Energy Hub would include wind turbines up to 270m tall, and be built inside active pine plantations, but its location has worried conservationists.

title.children: Planned wind farm next to Ramsar-listed wetlands passes 'significant' hurdle

image.altText: A young man on a beach eating an icecream.

props.synopsis: Summer has hit its stride with a heatwave across the country this week, providing the perfect backdrop to a new film festival that features beaches, surfing, young love, and that horrible feeling of holidays ebbing by.

title.children: Summer film festival to be launched in Adelaide by independent film collective

image.altText: A woman reads a book at a table stacked with more books inside a library

props.synopsis: The team at Adelaide's City of Marion Libraries grows a legion of fans on social media and sees their videos go viral, clocking up millions of views.

title.children: Adelaide's viral librarians rack up fans on social media — including Ariana Grande

image.altText: Two male tennis players wearing black shirts whisper to each other on the court.

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios and Thanasi Kokkinakis's doubles campaign at the Brisbane International has come to an end after an entertaining tiebreak decider against France.

title.children: Tiebreak defeat spells end for Special Ks at Brisbane International

image.altText: A two-storey building with a new garden, park benches and shade

props.synopsis: South Australia's doctors' union has raised concerns that clinicians were distressed when asked to admit more patients at a new mental health unit at Noarlunga Hospital when staffing levels were "not clinically safe".

title.children: Staff at new Adelaide mental health unit 'visibly distressed and crying', union says

image.altText: Stan Wawrinka wearing red colour shirt representing Switzerland, hitting a tennis ball

props.synopsis: Retiring veteran Stan Wawrinka was all class discussing the AO wildcard debate surrounding Nick Kyrgios, putting aside the pair's troubled history.

title.children: Wawrinka an unlikely ally for Kyrgios Australian Open wildcard

image.altText: A woman with a nose piercing stares seriously into the camera

props.synopsis: Investigators hold "grave fears" for Trisha Graf's wellbeing, after she was last seen in the early hours of December 12.

title.children: Disappearance of SA woman 'suspicious', police say

image.altText: A sign on a bridge noting when it was built

props.synopsis: South Australia's only vertical-lift bridge has been unable to rise for more than a week due to a mechanical malfunction, affecting holiday-makers and locals alike.

title.children: Historic Murray River bridge future uncertain as it nears its centenary

image.altText: A man sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: Australia's energy prices continue to soar as questions continue to be raised about the actions of providers, including by this pensioner who was overcharged and then had debt collectors chasing him.

title.children: How a 'ruthless' energy company went after a pensioner for money he didn't owe

image.altText: Donald Trump, in a dark blue suit and glossy blue tie, points a finger.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has made it clear he's departing from decades of US foreign policy norms and once-close allies are now questioning what it could mean for them.

title.children: Why Trump's threat to Greenland hinges on NATO's Article 5

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: ABC News has an exclusive interview with RBA deputy governor Andrew Hauser, who says he has a message that people may not want to hear.

title.children: ASX rises as RBA takes longer-term view on inflation — as it happened

image.altText: A man in an orange jacket uses binoculars to look at a ship in the distance

props.synopsis: Russia says one of the Venezuela-linked tankers is "our vessel" and demands the quick release of its citizens, as the US pledges to continue seizing ships and keep the pressure on Venezuela's interim leaders.

title.children: US seizes more tankers as it lays out three-phase plan for Venezuela

image.altText: A man with brown hair taking a selfi

props.synopsis: Isaac James Martin, 31, says he has not "bothered" to get legal representation, telling a Brisbane court he "killed old mate because he's a child molester".

title.children: 'I killed old mate': Prisoner confesses to killing 'child molester' inmate

image.altText: Damien Martyn and Adam Gilchrist celebrate a Test victory for Australia in 2004.

props.synopsis: Adam Gilchrist says his former Australia teammate Damien Martyn has been released from a Gold Coast hospital.

title.children: Ex-Test cricketer Martyn returns home after waking from induced coma

image.altText: torn apart car on fence

props.synopsis: The teenagers suffered serious leg injuries after the allegedly stolen car crashed into a fence in the early hours of the morning.

title.children: 13yo boys 'extremely lucky' to survive crash during police chase

image.altText: A composite image of two smiling boys, one in a black basketball top with a medal around his neck and the other in a white top.

props.synopsis: Homicide detectives lay further murder charges over the high-profile deaths of 15-year-old Dau Akueng and 12-year-old Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer suburbs last September.

title.children: Police lay further charges over Melbourne boys' stabbing deaths

image.altText: A triptych of three images from female social media influencers with text graphics overlaid

props.synopsis: Americans are posting sunny social media dispatches about their new lives in Australia, but there is something more revealing underneath.

title.children: How the 'American in Australia' trend reveals something about us and them

image.altText: Lachie Neale talking to media

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Lions will not stand in the way of Lachie Neale if the club's former co-captain chooses to return to Perth at the end of the season.

title.children: Neale has Lions' 'blessing' if he wants to return to Perth after 2026 season

image.altText: Water pours through open spillway gates on a towering concrete dam.

props.synopsis: A tropical low has been declared over the Coral Sea and it is expected to move towards the Far North Queensland coast over the next few days. The bureau said there is a moderate chance it could develop into a tropical cyclone.

title.children: Far North Queensland braces for a deluge of rain and possible cyclone

image.altText: Yasmine beams while standing in a granny flat kitchen that's different shades of green. She wears a green shirt and jean jacket.

props.synopsis: We chat with inimitable interior designer Yasmine Ghoniem ahead of Grand Designs Transformations series two to learn how she made it, her hot design takes, and what to expect from this season.

title.children: The two biggest renovation mistakes, according to this design show host

image.altText: A woman in a swimsuit and a swimming cap holds goggles over her head while smiling on a boat, with water dripping down.

props.synopsis: There is no lounging by the pool for these travellers, who are spending a week swimming the remote waters of the Turkish Lycian coast.

title.children: Older travellers 'feel good every day' with exercise-based holidays

image.altText: Chris Minns New South Wales Premier

props.synopsis: A decade-old Labor fundraiser at the centre of allegations that NSW Premier Chris Minns conspired to evade a state donations law was reported at the time as a much bigger event than official records suggest, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: 'Bunch of cash': The big little fundraiser causing problems for the NSW premier

image.altText: A crocodile swims at Crocodylus Park with trees reflected in the water.

props.synopsis: Rangers in the Northern Territory have caught an average of a crocodile per day in the first week of 2026, including one measuring 4.9 metres pulled from waters near a popular swimming spot.

title.children: Huge 4.9m-long crocodile pulled from NT creek that feeds popular waterfall

image.altText: Garry McDonald as Norman Gunston, combing his hair.

props.synopsis: From Academy Award-winning performances to classic Australian comedy, fill the last moments of your holidays with these free movies and TV series.

title.children: The best movies and TV series you can watch now — no fee required

image.altText: Firefighters and police at a house that caught on fire.

props.synopsis: Mohammed Khryzat, 38, died after a blaze ripped through a home on River Avenue Carramar in April 2021, having allegedly been left unsupervised by a care worker the night before.

title.children: NDIS contractor allegedly left home before client sparked fatal fire

image.altText: An image of an Indigenous man in a grey shirt standing in a park.

props.synopsis: Paul Silva says he plans to defy NSW's new protest restrictions to rally against Indigenous deaths in custody.

title.children: First Nations rally organiser vows to defy 'inhumane' NSW protest laws

image.altText: Police officers with backs to camera beside police van.

props.synopsis: Tactical Operations police burst into the Central Coast house and opened fire on a 49-year-old armed with a sharp object who tried to set fire to an officer using an aerosol can, police say.

title.children: NSW police storm house, fatally shoot man after six-hour siege

image.altText: Maya Joint pumps her fist at the United Cup.

props.synopsis: World number four Coco Gauff describes Maya Joint as a "great talent" ahead of a potential match-up against the 19-year-old Australian at the United Cup.

title.children: Two-time major winner Gauff heaps praise on rising Aussie star Joint

image.altText: An adult female mountain gorilla cuddles two twin babies.

props.synopsis: A mountain gorilla named Mafuko has given birth to twins, a "rare and remarkable event", in Virunga National Park in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

title.children: Rare twin mountain gorillas born in African national park
